description: Modify the version-specific settings of a Lambda function. When you update a function, Lambda provisions an instance of the function and its supporting resources. If your function connects to a VPC, this process can take a minute. During this time, you can't modify the function, but you can still invoke it. The LastUpdateStatus, LastUpdateStatusReason, and LastUpdateStatusReasonCode fields in the response from  GetFunctionConfiguration indicate when the update is complete and the function is processing events with the new configuration. For more information, see Lambda function states. These settings can vary between versions of a function and are locked when you publish a version. You can't modify the configuration of a published version, only the unpublished version. To configure function concurrency, use  PutFunctionConcurrency. To grant invoke permissions to an Amazon Web Services account or Amazon Web Services service, use  AddPermission.

parameters.name: FunctionName
parameters.description: The name or ARN of the Lambda function. Function name --- my-function. Function ARN --- arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:123456789012:function:my-function. Partial ARN --- 123456789012:function:my-function. The length constraint applies only to the full ARN. If you specify only the function name, it is limited to 64 characters in length.

parameters.name: VpcConfig
parameters.description: For network connectivity to Amazon Web Services resources in a VPC, specify a list of security groups and subnets in the VPC. When you connect a function to a VPC, it can access resources and the internet only through that VPC. For more information, see Configuring a Lambda function to access resources in a VPC. SubnetIds (list) --- A list of VPC subnet IDs. (string) --- SecurityGroupIds (list) --- A list of VPC security group IDs. (string) --- Ipv6AllowedForDualStack (boolean) --- Allows outbound IPv6 traffic on VPC functions that are connected to dual-stack subnets.

nested_params.name: SubnetIds
nested_params.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs.

nested_params.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_params.description: A list of VPC security group IDs.

nested_params.name: Ipv6AllowedForDualStack
nested_params.description: Allows outbound IPv6 traffic on VPC functions that are connected to dual-stack subnets.

parameters.name: Environment
parameters.description: Environment variables that are accessible from function code during execution. Variables (dict) --- Environment variable key-value pairs. For more information, see Using Lambda environment variables. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_params.name: Variables
nested_params.description: Environment variable key-value pairs. For more information, see Using Lambda environment variables.

parameters.name: Runtime
parameters.description: The identifier of the function's runtime. Runtime is required if the deployment package is a .zip file archive. Specifying a runtime results in an error if you're deploying a function using a container image. The following list includes deprecated runtimes. Lambda blocks creating new functions and updating existing functions shortly after each runtime is deprecated. For more information, see Runtime use after deprecation. For a list of all currently supported runtimes, see Supported runtimes.

parameters.name: DeadLetterConfig
parameters.description: A dead-letter queue configuration that specifies the queue or topic where Lambda sends asynchronous events when they fail processing. For more information, see Dead-letter queues. TargetArn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

nested_params.name: TargetArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

parameters.name: KMSKeyArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed key that's used to encrypt the following resources: The function's environment variables. The function's Lambda SnapStart snapshots. When used with SourceKMSKeyArn, the unzipped version of the .zip deployment package that's used for function invocations. For more information, see Specifying a customer managed key for Lambda. The optimized version of the container image that's used for function invocations. Note that this is not the same key that's used to protect your container image in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR). For more information, see Function lifecycle. If you don't provide a customer managed key, Lambda uses an Amazon Web Services owned key or an Amazon Web Services managed key.

parameters.name: TracingConfig
parameters.description: Set Mode to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with X-Ray. Mode (string) --- The tracing mode.

parameters.name: Layers
parameters.description: A list of function layers to add to the function's execution environment. Specify each layer by its ARN, including the version. (string) ---

parameters.name: FileSystemConfigs
parameters.description: Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system. (dict) --- Details about the connection between a Lambda function and an Amazon EFS file system. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system. The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.

nested_params.name: Arn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system.

nested_params.name: LocalMountPath
nested_params.description: The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.

parameters.name: ImageConfig
parameters.description: Container image configuration values that override the values in the container image Docker file. EntryPoint (list) --- Specifies the entry point to their application, which is typically the location of the runtime executable. (string) --- Command (list) --- Specifies parameters that you want to pass in with ENTRYPOINT. (string) --- WorkingDirectory (string) --- Specifies the working directory.

nested_params.name: EntryPoint
nested_params.description: Specifies the entry point to their application, which is typically the location of the runtime executable.

nested_params.name: Command
nested_params.description: Specifies parameters that you want to pass in with ENTRYPOINT.

parameters.name: EphemeralStorage
parameters.description: The size of the function's /tmp directory in MB. The default value is 512, but can be any whole number between 512 and 10,240 MB. For more information, see Configuring ephemeral storage (console). The size of the function's /tmp directory.

nested_params.name: Size
nested_params.description: The size of the function's /tmp directory.

parameters.name: SnapStart
parameters.description: The function's SnapStart setting. ApplyOn (string) --- Set to PublishedVersions to create a snapshot of the initialized execution environment when you publish a function version.

nested_params.name: ApplyOn
nested_params.description: Set to PublishedVersions to create a snapshot of the initialized execution environment when you publish a function version.

parameters.name: LoggingConfig
parameters.description: The function's Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings. LogFormat (string) --- The format in which Lambda sends your function's application and system logs to CloudWatch. Select between plain text and structured JSON. ApplicationLogLevel (string) --- Set this property to filter the application logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends application logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where TRACE is the highest level and FATAL is the lowest. SystemLogLevel (string) --- Set this property to filter the system logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends system logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where DEBUG is the highest level and WARN is the lowest. LogGroup (string) --- The name of the Amazon CloudWatch log group the function sends logs to. By default, Lambda functions send logs to a default log group named /aws/lambda/<function name>. To use a different log group, enter an existing log group or enter a new log group name.

nested_params.name: LogFormat
nested_params.description: The format in which Lambda sends your function's application and system logs to CloudWatch. Select between plain text and structured JSON.

nested_params.name: ApplicationLogLevel
nested_params.description: Set this property to filter the application logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends application logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where TRACE is the highest level and FATAL is the lowest.

nested_params.name: SystemLogLevel
nested_params.description: Set this property to filter the system logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends system logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where DEBUG is the highest level and WARN is the lowest.

nested_params.name: LogGroup
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon CloudWatch log group the function sends logs to. By default, Lambda functions send logs to a default log group named /aws/lambda/<function name>. To use a different log group, enter an existing log group or enter a new log group name.

nested_items.name: FunctionName
nested_items.description: The name of the function.

nested_items.description: The identifier of the function's runtime. Runtime is required if the deployment package is a .zip file archive. Specifying a runtime results in an error if you're deploying a function using a container image.

nested_items.description: The function's execution role.

nested_items.name: Handler
nested_items.description: The function that Lambda calls to begin running your function.

nested_items.name: CodeSize
nested_items.description: The size of the function's deployment package, in bytes.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The function's description.

nested_items.name: Timeout
nested_items.description: The amount of time in seconds that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it.

nested_items.name: MemorySize
nested_items.description: The amount of memory available to the function at runtime.

nested_items.name: LastModified
nested_items.description: The date and time that the function was last updated, in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD).

nested_items.name: CodeSha256
nested_items.description: The SHA256 hash of the function's deployment package.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version of the Lambda function.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: The function's networking configuration.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs.

nested_items.description: Allows outbound IPv6 traffic on VPC functions that are connected to dual-stack subnets.

nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

nested_items.description: The function's environment variables. Omitted from CloudTrail logs.

nested_items.description: Environment variable key-value pairs. Omitted from CloudTrail logs.

nested_items.description: The ARN of the Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed key that's used to encrypt the following resources:
The function's environment variables.
The function's Lambda SnapStart snapshots.
When used with SourceKMSKeyArn, the unzipped version of the .zip deployment package that's used for function invocations. For more information, see Specifying a customer managed key for Lambda.

The optimized version of the container image that's used for function invocations. Note that this is not the same key that's used to protect your container image in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR). For more information, see Function lifecycle.

nested_items.description: The function's X-Ray tracing configuration.

nested_items.description: The tracing mode.

nested_items.name: MasterArn
nested_items.description: For Lambda@Edge functions, the ARN of the main function.

nested_items.name: RevisionId
nested_items.description: The latest updated revision of the function or alias.

nested_items.description: The function's layers.

nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function layer.

nested_items.name: CodeSize

nested_items.name: SigningProfileVersionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a signing profile version.

nested_items.name: SigningJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a signing job.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the function. When the state is Inactive, you can reactivate the function by invoking it.

nested_items.name: StateReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the function's current state.

nested_items.name: StateReasonCode
nested_items.description: The reason code for the function's current state. When the code is Creating, you can't invoke or modify the function.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the last update that was performed on the function. This is first set to Successful after function creation completes.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateStatusReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the last update that was performed on the function.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateStatusReasonCode
nested_items.description: The reason code for the last update that was performed on the function.

nested_items.name: FileSystemConfigs
nested_items.description: Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system.

nested_items.name: LocalMountPath
nested_items.description: The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.

nested_items.name: PackageType
nested_items.description: The type of deployment package. Set to Image for container image and set Zip for .zip file archive.

nested_items.name: ImageConfigResponse
nested_items.description: The function's image configuration values.

nested_items.name: ImageConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration values that override the container image Dockerfile.

nested_items.name: EntryPoint
nested_items.description: Specifies the entry point to their application, which is typically the location of the runtime executable.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: Specifies parameters that you want to pass in with ENTRYPOINT.

nested_items.description: Error code.

nested_items.description: The ARN of the signing profile version.

nested_items.name: SigningJobArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the signing job.

nested_items.name: Architectures
nested_items.description: The instruction set architecture that the function supports. Architecture is a string array with one of the valid values. The default architecture value is x86_64.

nested_items.description: The size of the function's /tmp directory in MB. The default value is 512, but can be any whole number between 512 and 10,240 MB. For more information, see Configuring ephemeral storage (console).

nested_items.name: SnapStart
nested_items.description: Set ApplyOn to PublishedVersions to create a snapshot of the initialized execution environment when you publish a function version. For more information, see Improving startup performance with Lambda SnapStart.

nested_items.name: ApplyOn
nested_items.description: When set to PublishedVersions, Lambda creates a snapshot of the execution environment when you publish a function version.

nested_items.name: OptimizationStatus
nested_items.description: When you provide a qualified Amazon Resource Name (ARN), this response element indicates whether SnapStart is activated for the specified function version.

nested_items.description: The ARN of the runtime and any errors that occured.

nested_items.description: The format in which Lambda sends your function's application and system logs to CloudWatch. Select between plain text and structured JSON.

nested_items.name: ApplicationLogLevel
nested_items.description: Set this property to filter the application logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends application logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where TRACE is the highest level and FATAL is the lowest.

nested_items.name: SystemLogLevel
nested_items.description: Set this property to filter the system logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends system logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where DEBUG is the highest level and WARN is the lowest.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon CloudWatch log group the function sends logs to. By default, Lambda functions send logs to a default log group named /aws/lambda/<function name>. To use a different log group, enter an existing log group or enter a new log group name.
